BIO 101.question: A scientist known for transformation experiments with bacteria was __________.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: Frederick Griffith was known for transformation experiments with bacteria.
BIO 101.hint: His experiments involved mixing heat-killed pathogenic and live non-pathogenic bacteria.

BIO 101.question: __________ demonstrated that DNA was the transforming principle.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: Oswald Avery demonstrated that DNA was the transforming principle.
BIO 101.hint: His work built upon Griffith's experiments to identify the molecule of inheritance.

BIO 101.question: The scientist who established that A=T and C=G was __________.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: Erwin Chargaff established that A=T and C=G.
BIO 101.hint: This base-pairing rule is named after him.

BIO 101.question: __________ produced critical X-ray diffraction images of DNA.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: Rosalind Franklin (and Maurice Wilkins) produced critical X-ray diffraction images of DNA.
BIO 101.hint: Image 51, from her work, was crucial in deducing DNA's structure.

BIO 101.question: The Hershey-Chase experiment used __________ to confirm DNA is the genetic material.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: The Hershey-Chase experiment used bacteriophages (viruses) to confirm DNA is the genetic material.
BIO 101.hint: They labeled the protein coat and DNA of viruses with different radioactive isotopes.

BIO 101.question: __________ proposed an incorrect triple-helix model of DNA.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: Linus Pauling proposed an incorrect triple-helix model of DNA.
BIO 101.hint: This chemist is also famous for his work on the structure of proteins and chemical bonds.

BIO 101.question: The scientists who deduced the double-helix structure of DNA were __________ and __________.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: The scientists who deduced the double-helix structure of DNA were James Watson and Francis Crick.

BIO 101.question: The discoverer of 'nuclein' (DNA) was __________.
BIO 101.topic: Foundations of Biology – From Scientific Inquiry to the Central Dogma
BIO 101.explanation: The discoverer of 'nuclein' (DNA) was Friedrich Miescher.
BIO 101.hint: He isolated the substance from white blood cell nuclei in the 1860s.
